com.esri.mo2.data.feat
Class BaseField

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.data.feat.BaseField
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Field, Serializable
public class BaseField
extends Object
implements Field, Serializable

This class is a standard implementation of a Field.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Specified by:

cloneData

public Object cloneData(Object data)
Description copied from interface: Field
Creates a clone of the specified data which is assumed to be of the type defined by this Field. This was needed because most basic data types such as Integer and Double do not have a clone.

Specified by:
cloneData in interface Field
Parameters:
data - the data to be cloned
Returns:
the cloned data
See Also:
Field.clone(), Row.clone()

format

public String format(Object val)
Description copied from interface: Field
Formats the given value that corresponds with the current Field's type, into a String that is appropriate for the current locale. If any conversion errors occurs, they are trapped, and a blank string is returned instead.

Specified by:
format in interface Field
Parameters:
val - the value to be formatted
Returns:
the formatted string

locale - the required Locale
Returns:
the formatted string

getStandardIntegerFormat

public static NumberFormat getStandardIntegerFormat(Locale locale)
Returns a NumberFormat that is used by default to format integer numbers. The default format is setup with 0 fraction digits, maximum of 20 integer digits, minimum 1 integer digit, and no grouping.

Parameters:
locale - the required Locale
Returns:
the NumberFormat used for integers

getStandardDateTimeFormat

public static DateFormat getStandardDateTimeFormat(Locale locale)
Returns a DateTimeFormat that is used by default to format dates of type Date/Time. The default format is setup with MEDIUM date and MEDIUM time.

Parameters:
locale - the required Locale
Returns:
the DateFormat used for dates

getStandardDateFormat

public static DateFormat getStandardDateFormat(Locale locale)
Returns a DateFormat that is used by default to format dates of type Date. The default format is setup with MEDIUM date.

Parameters:
locale - the required Locale
Returns:
the DateFormat used for dates

getStandardDoubleFormat

public static NumberFormat getStandardDoubleFormat(Locale locale)
Returns a NumberFormat that is used by default to format floating point numbers. The default format is obtained from DoubleConversion.getStandardFormat().

Parameters:
locale - the required Locale
Returns:
the NumberFormat used for floating point
See Also:
DoubleConversion.getStandardFormat(java.util.Locale)

getIntegerFormat

public NumberFormat getIntegerFormat(Locale locale)
Returns a reference to the NumberFormat used by this Field to format integer numbers of all types.

Parameters:
locale - the required Locale
Returns:
the NumberFormat used for integers

getDoubleFormat

public NumberFormat getDoubleFormat(Locale locale)
Returns a reference to the NumberFormat used by this Field to parse floating point numbers of all types, and to format them when within "reasonable limits".

Parameters:
locale - the required Locale
Returns:
the NumberFormat used for floating point
See Also:
getCombinedFormat(java.util.Locale)

parseNoDefault

public Object parseNoDefault(String val,
                             Locale locale)
                      throws Exception
Description copied from interface: Field
Similar to the other parse methods, but does not return a default value if any conversion error occurs. Instead, an exception will be thrown.

Specified by:
parseNoDefault in interface Field
Parameters:
val - the value to be parsed
locale - the locale
Returns:
the resulting object
Throws:
Exception - if any conversion errors occurs
See Also:
Field.parse(String,java.util.Locale)

parse

public Object parse(String val)
A blank string for numeric types yields zero.

Specified by:
parse in interface Field
Parameters:
val - the string to be parsed
Returns:
the parsed value as an object

defaultValue

public Object defaultValue()
Default implementation returns "0" [false for Boolean]. You can construct a subclass of BaseField, and override this method to provide different default values if you choose.

Specified by:
defaultValue in interface Field
